objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The authoring organization of the 'Pygmy Goat' malware analysis report, as indicated by the copyright notice and YARA rule metadata.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat malware path
objects.description: File path where the Pygmy Goat malware is stored on the compromised device.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat IPC socket
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket created by Pygmy Goat for inter-process communication.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat IPC socket
objects.description: IPC Unix client socket created by Pygmy Goat, possibly to mimic FortiGate processes.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat IPC socket (older sample)
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket used by an older sample of Pygmy Goat.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat PID file
objects.description: Single instance PID file used by Pygmy Goat to ensure only one instance is running.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat PID file (older sample)
objects.description: Single instance PID file used by an older sample of Pygmy Goat.

objects.description: MD5 hash of the embedded Root CA certificate used by Pygmy Goat to verify its C2 server.

objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the embedded Root CA certificate used by Pygmy Goat to verify its C2 server.

objects.name: pygmy goat
objects.description: A native x86-32 ELF shared object discovered on Sophos XG firewall devices, providing backdoor access. It uses the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to get loaded into /bin/sshd and hook its accept function. It can be triggered via a raw ICMP socket listening for encrypted connect-back information or by a magic byte sequence in an SSH connection. Its functionality includes remote shell, packet capture, cron task creation, and establishing a reverse SOCKS proxy server.

objects.name: castletap
objects.description: A malware mentioned in Mandiant reporting on attacks against FortiGate devices. It has similar TTPs to Pygmy Goat, such as using an encrypted ICMP packet containing C2 information to establish a reverse SSL connection.

objects.name: Sophos
objects.description: Vendor of the XG firewall devices where the Pygmy Goat malware was discovered.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: A network device vendor whose 'FortiGate' product is impersonated in Pygmy Goat's embedded Root CA certificate. The report suggests Pygmy Goat may have initially been intended for FortiGate devices.

objects.name: Mandiant
objects.description: A cybersecurity firm cited in the report for its reporting on the EarthWorm tool and attacks on FortiGate devices involving the CASTLETAP malware.

objects.name: CrowdStrike
objects.description: A cybersecurity firm cited in the report for its reporting on the previous use of the EarthWorm tool by threat actors.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_aes_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_magic_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule pygmy_goat_magic_strings
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Pygmy Goat magic byte sequences used in C2 comms"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$c2_magic_handshake = ",bEB3?=o"
$fake_ssh_banner = "SSH-2.0-D8pjE"
$fake_ed25519_key = { 29 cc f0 cc 16 c5 46 6e 52 19 82 8e 86

65 42 8c 1f 1a d4 c3 a5 b1 cb fc c0 26 6c 31 3c 5c 90 3a 24 7d e4 d3 57
6d da 8e cb f4 66 d1 cb 81 4f 63 fd 4a fa 06 e4 7e 4c a0 95 91 bd cb 97
a4 b3 0f }

condition:

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and any of them

}

objects.name: earthworm_id_generation_x86
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule earthworm_id_generation_x86
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "EarthWorm pool num generation x86 assembly"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$chartoi = {

8b 45 ??        // MOV
c1 e0 07        // SHL
89 c1           // MOV
8b 55 ??        // MOV
8b 45 ??        // MOV
01 d0           // ADD
0f b6 00        // MOVZX
0f be c0        // MOVSX
01 c8           // ADD
89 45 ??        // MOV
83 6d ?? 01     // SUB

EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,0x7
ECX,EAX
EDX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,EDX
EAX,byte ptr [EAX]
EAX,AL
EAX,ECX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],EAX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],0x1

}

condition:

}

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and all of them

objects.name: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to inject into sshd

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a /bin/sh or /bin/csh remote shell

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Cron
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create arbitrary cron tasks using crontab

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses Unix sockets for inter-process communication between parent and forked child processes

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can use libpcap to sniff network traffic according to a BPF filter and exfiltrate it to the C2

objects.name: Traffic Signaling: Port Knocking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat listens on an ICMP raw socket for encrypted packets containing magic bytes and the C2 address to connect back to

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol Impersonation
objects.description: Pygmy Goat responds to an SSH connection that sends magic bytes with a fake SSH handshake

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Asymmetric Cryptography
objects.description: Pygmy Goat encrypts C2 communications with TLS

objects.name: Protocol Tunneling
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a reverse SOCKS5 proxy server to tunnel traffic through it

objects.name: Archive Collected Data: Archive via Library
objects.description: Pygmy Goat compresses its C2 communications with LZO1X

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Pygmy Goat exfiltrates its result data over its C2 channel

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Pygmy Goat
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. pygmy goat.
